problem: 如果 $\frac{\sin (2A + B)}{\sin B} = 5,$ 则求 $\frac{\tan (A + B)}{\tan A}.$
solution:
从 $\frac{\sin (2A + B)}{\sin B} = 5$，我们有 $\sin (2A + B) = 5 \sin B$。我们可以将其写成 $\sin (A + (A + B)) = 5 \sin ((A + B) - A)$，根据角度的加减公式，
\[\sin A \cos (A + B) + \cos A \sin (A + B) = 5 \sin (A + B) \cos A - 5 \cos (A + B) \sin A.\]
进而得到
\[6 \sin A \cos (A + B) = 4 \sin (A + B) \cos A,\]
因此
\[\frac{\sin (A + B) \cos A}{\cos (A + B) \sin A} = \frac{3}{2}.\]
换句话说，
\[\frac{\tan (A + B)}{\tan A} = \boxed{\frac{3}{2}}.\]
